description: The BHS segment defines the start of a batch

1.name: Batch Field Separator
1.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

10.name: Batch Comment
10.description: comment field that is not further defined in the HL7 protocol

11.name: Batch Control Id
11.description: used to uniquely identify a particular batch. It can be echoed back in BHS-12-reference batch control ID if an answering batch is needed

12.name: Reference Batch Control Id
12.description: value of BHS-11-batch control ID when this batch was originally transmitted. Not present if this batch is being sent for the first time. See definition for BHS-11-batch control ID

2.name: Batch Encoding Characters
2.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

3.name: Batch Sending Application
3.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

4.name: Batch Sending Facility
4.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

5.name: Batch Receiving Application
5.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

6.name: Batch Receiving Facility
6.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

7.name: Batch Creation Date / Time
7.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

8.name: Batch Security
8.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

9.name: Batch Name / Id / Type
9.description: can be used by the application processing the batch. It can have extra components if needed
